title: Kings of Judah and Israel
summary: Abijam rules briefly in Judah, followed by Asa, who reforms the kingdom and removes idols. In Israel, Nadab succeeds Jeroboam but is killed by Baasha, who then becomes king and continues in sin.

faq.question: What reforms did King Asa make?
faq.answer: He removed idols, deposed his idolatrous grandmother, and turned Judah back to God.

faq.question: How did Baasha become king of Israel?
